meaningMnemonic: A <kanji>chair</kanji> <kanji>child</kanji> is for some reason just a <vocabulary>chair</vocabulary>. Not sure why it's a child, but it is.
readingMnemonic: The reading for 子 is weird. It's す, so think about how you sat on this chair and it broke, so you <reading>sue</reading>d (す) the person who made the chair (who happened to be a child).
